title: Business & Finance
text:
A record 47.2% of U.S. equity trading volume in January was executed outside public stock exchanges, up from 39.9% a year earlier.

---

Major U.S. stock indexes closed at records Friday. The S&P 500, Dow and Nasdaq had weekly gains of 1.2%, 1% and 1.7%, respectively.

---

American Express acknowledged that the Justice Department and other agencies have reviewed the company's sales practices regarding small-business cards.

---

Four pharmaceutical firms in opioid settlement talks with states stand to reap about $1 billion each in tax breaks if a combined payout of more than $26 billion is finalized.

---

II-VI made a roughly $6.5 billion bid for Coherent, setting up a seldom-seen, three-way takeover battle for the laser maker.
